text:
Zossimov sat at the foot of the sofa. He looked at Raskolnikov. 

“How do we feel now, eh?” he asked, adjusting his spectacles.

Razumihin chimed in, “He’s come to himself.”

Raskolnikov frowned. “I am well, perfectly well!” 

He raised himself, irritation bubbling beneath the surface. 

Razumihin continued, “He is still depressed. We changed his linen.”

Zossimov nodded slowly. “That’s natural. His pulse is first-rate.”

Raskolnikov turned away, gazing at the wall.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Zossimov, a doctor, observes Raskolnikov's recovery while noting his continued depression and irritability.
